item.title: George Bush
item.dc:creator: @blah_bah7 blah bah7
item.description:
@blah_bah7 wrote:

im frickin SICK of george bush… IMPEACH!!![br][size=1]Posted on: April 08, 2007, 07:19:21 AM[/size][hr][quote=“Hypocrite, post:7, topic:67366”]Although I don’t agree with everything he has done, he really didn’t have a ton of choice in alot of things.

Take the war in Iraq for instance. We went over because we thought they had weapons. People would hate Bush if we didn’t go over and they actually DID have weapons.

Like I said, I ain’t saying he’s the smartest guy we ever had lead our country, but I think he is actually trying to do something right (just not trying very hard).[/quote]

then hy didnt we leave when we learned they had no weapons

and what happened to Osama bin Laden, hes the one who blw up the twin towers, why arent we aiming for him

item.title: George Bush
item.dc:creator: @Hypocrite Hypocrite
item.description:
@Hypocrite wrote:

Got_Shine:

Oh and Hypocrite here seems to be the only one with any knowledge of whats going on, most everyone else is just saying random shit.

Thank you for having half a brain!

Eh Pretty Easy:

I think the next president should be a woman, since men’s are more aggressive than womans. If there would be a woman running a country, she wouldn’t be like “OMFG THRS OIL LTS TK IT!!!” instead, she would go to the country and make deals. Buy oil for a fair price instead starting a war.

You are so off base on that I don’t know where to begin.

For one, presidents usually do what their advisors tell them to. A woman would do the same as a man if their advisors told them the same thing. We went to war over the suspicion of WMDs, not because we wanted to “OMFG THRS OIL LTS TK IT!!!”.

[quote=“Zezimaaa, post:22, topic:67366”][quote author=zoltanman link=topic=98394.msg1009024#msg1009024 date=1173829334]
=P I think it’s like 72% of the people are obies. Not quite sure I don’t do facts on USA…
[/quote] we amercian r not all obses most of us r skinny the new spread lie and i live in american and i dont want war it just fag bush want to blow shit up[/quote]

We are not ALL obese, but most of us are not skinny by any stretch. I live in America too. Nobody wants war but something needs to be done.

You are why people hate america

item.title: George Bush
item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

[quote=“Zezimaaa, post:26, topic:67366”][quote author=Bebemycat2 link=topic=98394.msg1009596#msg1009596 date=1173835836]

[quote author=Zezimaaa link=topic=98394.msg1009536#msg1009536 date=1173835327]

He has one year left in his term, let him play his war games.

Personally I think he is…well, below average education standards. Pus I feel he favors big business more than he favors the middle or working class citizens.

Vote for John Edwards or Joe Biden in '08
</3 Hillery, she needs to stop relying on Bill (The real first black president)
[/quote] i think he has 2 term left bisde i would vote for Biden cuz he sound smart and doesnt act like a chimp i think hillery is running for prez and geogre bush might be vice prez then hillery would resign the other 4 year of chimp ass

You have no idea what you are talking about.

Bush became president in 2000. The current year is 2007. He won the election for a second term of four years in 2004. Thus his second term is over in 2008 (next year). He can’t run for more then two terms of office (not like he would win with an approval rating of 29-35%).

I prefer Biden and Edwards because they are “straight” talkers.Basically they get right to the point and actually express their opinions in a smart fashion, unlike the other political “robots” out there.

Hillery Clinton is a democrat. George W. Bush is a republican. They can’t run with each other, only against each other (which isn’t possible now since Bush is finishing up his second term).
Even if Hillery were to become president and then decided not to run for a second term, the vice president doesn’t take power. New candidates are chosen and elected from that process.

Please actually have knowledge of the political system before you come into a political debate.
[/quote] vice prez can take power in the middle of a term[/quote]
A presidential term in the United States of America = four years.

Now it is true that the Vice President can take power in the middle of a presidential term, but only if the acting president is rendered incapable to lead (death, mental illness, hostage situation or many other possibilities).
But you said that Bush would be the Vice President to Hillary, which would never happen unless Bush was to switch political parties and gain a huge approval rating within the next year (extremely unlikely).

Read full topic

item.title: George Bush
item.dc:creator: @Got_Shine Got_Shine
item.description:
@Got_Shine wrote:

[quote=“Eh Pretty Easy, post:13, topic:67366”]I would have made months of research to find the people behind the 911, not just rush and attack Iraq. Saddam was encouraging him to attack Iraq, he shouldn’t have done that. It is obvious that Saddam wasn’t behind 911. Why he attacked Iraq? Osama isn’t in Iraq…[/quote]The united states did research who was behind 911, and it took several weeks, it wasn’t an immediate attack.
We found out it was alkahda (SP?) which had been lead by Osama bin laden, so we attack AFGHANISTAN. This has nothing to do with Iraq. We invaded Iraq because there was evidence of WMDs. Fortunately there turned out to be none and there was nothing to worry about, but like hypocrite said,

People would hate Bush if we didn’t go over and they actually DID have weapons.

However, I’m not defending Bush at all, I think he’s a war hungry, corrupt piece of shit, along with everyone involved in the Bush Administration.

Oh and Hypocrite here seems to be the only one with any knowledge of whats going on, most everyone else is just saying random shit.
